titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Society of the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick in the City of New York 121st anniversary banquet program ARC.262
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

did.unittitle: Society of the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick in the City of New York 121st anniversary banquet program

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Society of the Friendly Sons of Saint Patrick in the City of New York

did.abstract: Program from the 121st anniversary banquet of the Society of the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick in the City of New York, dating from 1905.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single item.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Society of the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick in the City of New York was founded in 1784 as a charitable and social organization for Irish Americans residing in New York City.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Society of the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick in the City of New York 121st anniversary banquet program, 1905, ARC.262; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One program from the 121st anniversary banquet of the Society of the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick in the City of New York, dating from 1905.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain.
